body.p:
His Excellency
B Magoffin Gov. of Kenty

Your Petitioner Lewis Goodwall would most respectfully State that at the October term 1860 of the Jefferson Circuit Court he was tried for a felony in Said Court and Convicted and sent to the Penitentiary for the term of three years where he has been Confined at hard labour Ever Since &c -- Now your petitioner would State honestly that he is between 70 & 80 years of age -- that this is the first charge Ever made against him -- and that he is not conscious of committing the offence -- at the time it was committed -- he was charged with killing a cow, the property of Valentine Keardall, skinning the cow and leaving the carcass on the command in Louisville -- If I committed the offence I was not in a state of mind to recollect it -- tho the proof was against me -- He says that he is now very old and feble -- that up to that time he had always born a good name and done Justly towards all men -- that he can cannot live much longer -- that he has already Suffered much and that in view of all the facts of the case he implores your Excellency to grant him a pardon and he will ever pray &c
We the undersigned were Members of the Jury who tried the within petitioner and unite with him in asking your Excellency to Pardon him Feby 3d 1862

D C Hinskall
S Spalding Jr
W N Hyden
John Trainor
L R Thompson
G. P. Williams
B. W.
We the undersigned Citizens of Louisville unite with the said petitioner in asking your Excellency to grant him a pardon believing his a case that appeals to Executive Clemency
